resources.title: ACEs Aware Initiative - Official Resources
resources.description: California's official ACEs Aware program provides comprehensive training, screening tools, and clinical protocols for healthcare providers to identify and respond to toxic stress. Access free training modules and implementation guides.

resources.title: RRC Toolkit for Educators - CDPH
resources.description: The California Department of Public Health's Recognize, Respond, Connect toolkit specifically designed for K-12 educators. Includes classroom strategies, communication templates, and student support frameworks.

resources.title: California Healthy Kids Survey Resources
resources.description: Free survey tools and resources to assess school climate, student wellness, and resilience factors. Includes data analysis support and evidence-based recommendations for school improvement.

resources.title: Trauma-Informed Schools Implementation Guide
resources.description: Step-by-step guide from California's School Climate, Health, and Learning Survey system for creating trauma-informed school environments. Features implementation checklists and staff training modules.

resources.title: ACEs Connection Community Network
resources.description: Online community connecting educators, counselors, and administrators working with trauma-affected students. Share strategies, access webinars, and connect with California-based practitioners.

resources.title: California Teachers Association - Trauma-Informed Practices
resources.description: CTA's comprehensive resource library for trauma-informed teaching practices. Includes lesson plans, professional development materials, and advocacy resources for California educators.

resources.title: Los Angeles Unified School District - Trauma Informed Schools
resources.description: LAUSD's trauma-informed schools initiative with downloadable implementation guides, classroom posters, and family engagement materials. Proven strategies from the nation's second-largest school district.

resources.title: California School-Based Health Alliance
resources.description: Resources for school nurses, counselors, and health staff working with trauma-affected students. Includes referral protocols, mental health screening tools, and wellness program templates.

resources.title: CDC-Kaiser ACE Study - Original Research
resources.description: Access the groundbreaking original ACEs study that established the link between childhood adversity and long-term health outcomes. Essential reading for understanding the evidence base behind trauma-informed practices.

resources.title: SAMHSA Trauma-Informed Care Implementation Guide
resources.description: Federal guidance on creating trauma-informed systems in schools and communities. Includes the six key principles of trauma-informed care and practical implementation strategies.

resources.title: National Child Traumatic Stress Network - School Resources
resources.description: Comprehensive collection of evidence-based resources for educators working with traumatized students. Features age-specific interventions, crisis response protocols, and family engagement tools.

resources.title: California Department of Education - Social Emotional Learning
resources.description: CDE's official SEL resources aligned with trauma-informed practices. Includes curriculum frameworks, assessment tools, and integration strategies for elementary through high school.

resources.title: San Francisco Unified - Wellness Centers Toolkit
resources.description: SFUSD's comprehensive toolkit for establishing student wellness centers. Features staffing models, funding strategies, and trauma-informed service delivery protocols proven effective in California urban schools.

resources.title: California School Safety Plan Template
resources.description: Trauma-informed school safety planning template that balances security with supportive school climate. Developed by California Office of Emergency Services for K-12 schools.

resources.title: Restorative Justice Practices in California Schools
resources.description: Guide to implementing restorative justice as an alternative to traditional discipline. Features case studies from California schools, training materials, and circle facilitation guides.

resources.title: California's Multi-Tiered System of Supports Framework
resources.description: Comprehensive MTSS framework integrating academic, behavioral, and social-emotional supports. Includes implementation guides, assessment tools, and professional learning modules for California educators.

resources.title: Elementary School Trauma-Informed Classroom Strategies
resources.description: Practical strategies for elementary teachers to create predictable, safe learning environments. Features morning routines, sensory breaks, and emotion regulation activities for K-5 students.

resources.title: Adverse Childhood Experiences in California Schools - Data Report
resources.description: California-specific ACEs prevalence data with analysis by region, ethnicity, and grade level. Essential for understanding the scope of trauma exposure in California student populations.

resources.title: Self-Care for Educators Working with Trauma
resources.description: Evidence-based self-care strategies for teachers and staff experiencing secondary traumatic stress. Includes wellness assessments, burnout prevention, and stress management techniques.

resources.title: California Evidence-Based Clearinghouse for Child Welfare
resources.description: Searchable database of evidence-based programs for supporting children affected by trauma and adversity. Rates program effectiveness and provides implementation guidance.

resources.title: Middle School Transition Support for Trauma-Affected Students
resources.description: Specialized resources for supporting students transitioning to middle school. Includes peer mentoring programs, orientation strategies, and family engagement tools designed for grades 6-8.

resources.title: High School Trauma-Informed Discipline Alternatives
resources.description: Research-based alternatives to suspension and expulsion for high schools. Features conflict mediation, behavioral contracts, and reintegration plans that maintain school connection.

resources.title: California Community Schools Partnership Network
resources.description: Network connecting community schools across California. Access shared resources, funding opportunities, and collaborative learning spaces focused on integrated student supports.

resources.title: Screening Tools for Student Wellbeing - California Edition
resources.description: Collection of validated screening instruments for identifying students experiencing trauma or toxic stress. Includes scoring guides, referral protocols, and family communication templates.

resources.title: California County Office of Education Resources
resources.description: Regional professional development resources and technical assistance for trauma-informed practices. Access county-specific training calendars, coaching services, and implementation support.

resources.title: Classroom Management Strategies for Trauma-Affected Elementary Students
resources.description: Positive behavior interventions specifically designed for K-5 classrooms. Features visual schedules, reward systems, and de-escalation techniques that support regulation.

resources.title: Building Resilience in Adolescents - Research Summary
resources.description: Meta-analysis of protective factors and resilience-building interventions for middle and high school students. Includes practical applications of research findings for educators.

resources.title: California School Counselors Association - Trauma Resources
resources.description: Professional resources specifically for school counselors, psychologists, and social workers. Includes crisis intervention protocols, counseling techniques, and supervision guidelines.

resources.title: Family Engagement Strategies for Trauma-Affected Families
resources.description: Culturally responsive strategies for engaging families experiencing trauma or adversity. Features communication templates, home visit protocols, and parent education resources.

resources.title: Neuroscience of Trauma - Educator-Friendly Guide
resources.description: Accessible explanation of how trauma affects brain development and learning. Helps educators understand the science behind trauma-informed practices and student behavior.

resources.title: California's Expanded Learning Opportunities Program
resources.description: State-funded afterschool and summer programs with trauma-informed frameworks. Includes program planning tools, staffing guidelines, and enrichment activity libraries.

resources.title: Mindfulness and Trauma-Sensitive Yoga in Schools
resources.description: Evidence-based mindfulness and movement practices adapted for trauma-affected students. Features downloadable lesson plans, breathing exercises, and classroom yoga sequences for all ages.

resources.title: California Association of School Psychologists - ACEs Resources
resources.description: Professional development materials, assessment tools, and intervention frameworks for school psychologists working with trauma-affected students across California districts.

resources.title: Culturally Responsive Trauma-Informed Practices
resources.description: Framework for integrating cultural responsiveness with trauma-informed care. Addresses implicit bias, historical trauma, and equity considerations in supporting diverse student populations.

resources.title: California Positive Behavioral Interventions & Supports
resources.description: State PBIS center providing implementation resources, training opportunities, and technical assistance. Features California-specific data, funding information, and success stories.

resources.title: California School Dashboard - Student Wellbeing Metrics
resources.description: Access statewide data on suspension rates, chronic absenteeism, and other indicators of student wellbeing. Essential for tracking trauma-informed practice outcomes and identifying schools needing additional support.

resources.title: San Diego County Office of Education - Trauma-Sensitive Schools
resources.description: Comprehensive implementation framework for becoming a trauma-sensitive school district. Includes administrator guides, staff training curricula, and evaluation tools specifically designed for California school systems.

resources.title: California Education Code - Student Mental Health Resources
resources.description: Complete legal framework for student mental health services in California schools. Includes mandated reporting requirements, confidentiality guidelines, and state funding opportunities for trauma-informed initiatives.

resources.title: California School Climate Survey - Free Implementation Resources
resources.description: No-cost survey tools and professional development for measuring and improving school climate in California districts. Features trauma-informed climate indicators, action planning templates, and technical assistance.

resources.title: Sacramento County Office of Education - Early Childhood Trauma Resources
resources.description: Specialized resources for addressing trauma in early childhood education settings (Pre-K through Grade 3). Features developmentally appropriate interventions, family partnership strategies, and transition planning for California educators.
